p: Almost half of all deaths in children under 5 worldwide are due to malnutrition and the majority of them are living in Sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia [ 19]. More than 80% of the worldsâ€™ population lives in poor countries with <$10 a day and almost half of the world population live on a daily income of less than $2.50 [ 20]. Due to the poverty, malnutrition is one of the biggest social problems in the poverty-ridden areas and many children suffer from one or more forms of malnutrition. The Food and Agriculture Organization indicated that about 154.8 million (22.9%) and 51.7 million children (7.7%) under 5 in the world suffer from stunted growth and wasting, respectively, due to malnutrition [ 21].
